Uses of Class
simulator.payloads.Networkable

  • Packages that use Networkable 
    Package Description
    simulator.elevatorcontrol
    Contains classes that manipulate the simulated environmental objects.
    simulator.elevatormodules
    Provides sensors for detecting car position, door position, and door reversal triggers, and actuators for turning on button lights moving the doors.
    simulator.framework
    Provides the core infrastructure for simulating the network and elevator.
    simulator.payloads
    The message types that can be sent on the simulated network.

    • Uses of Networkable in simulator.elevatorcontrol

      Subclasses of Networkable in simulator.elevatorcontrol 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  CarButtonControl 
      class  Dispatcher
      This dispatcher determines the elevator's future destinations This dispatcher is a numb one, it stops at every floor and operates all the time.
      class  DoorControl 
      class  DriveControl
      This DriveControl which controls the elevator Drive (the main motor moving Car Up and Down).
      class  HallButtonControl 
      class  SampleDispatcherMonitor
      This example monitor shows how to use the RuntimeMonitor hooks to check for fast speed between floors.
      class  SamplePerformanceMonitor
      This monitoring class gives you a starting point for the performance checks you will do in project 7.

    • Uses of Networkable in simulator.elevatormodules

      Subclasses of Networkable in simulator.elevatormodules 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AtFloorSensor
      System object that detects when the Car is within a specified distance from a floor landing.
      class  CarButtonLight
      implementation of the physical button and light The main purpose of this class is to provide an interface for the passenger objects.
      class  CarLantern
      Provides a passenger interface to the car lanterns
      class  CarLevelPositionSensor
      Sends CarLevelPositionnetwork messages when the Car passes one of the position sensors on the hoistway rails.
      class  CarPositionIndicator
      Provides a passenger interface to the car lanterns
      class  CarWeightAlarm
      Provides a passenger interface to the car lanterns
      class  CarWeightSensor
      Controls the weight alarm inside the car.
      class  Door
      provides a passenger interface to the doors
      class  DoorClosedSensor
      Sends network messages to indicate whether each door is less than 1% open.
      class  DoorMotor
      Models the doors of the elevator in the simulation.
      class  DoorOpenedSensor
      Sends network messages to indicate whether each door is greater than 99% open.
      class  DoorReversalSensor
      This module receives the framework reversals from the passengers and sends them on the network.
      class  DriveObject
      Models the motion of the car in the simulation.
      class  HallButtonLight
      implementation of the physical button and light The main purpose of this class is to provide an interface for the passenger objects.
      class  HoistwayLimitSensor
      Listens for CarPositionPayload framework messages and sends network and framework HoistwayLimitPayload messages when the Car exceeds a specified position.
      class  LevelingSensor
      Implement a physical model of the leveling vane.
      class  Module
      Utility superclass for system modules.
      class  PassengerModule
      subclass of module that sends passenger events
      class  Safety
      A safety certification node that looks for "dangerous" (as specified in the elevator requirements) operation of the elevator and sends an EmergencyBrakePayload message on the framework and network if such a condition is detected.

    • Uses of Networkable in simulator.framework

      Subclasses of Networkable in simulator.framework 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Controller
      The Controller object provides an abstract framework that you will use to build your distributed elevator controllers.
      class  FaultInjector
      Responsible for creating and injecting fault objects as defined by the fault file (-ff).
      class  MessageInjector
      This class is responsible for parsing mf files and creating the objects that do the actual message injections and assertion monitoring.
      class  PassengerController
      The driver for all the Passengers in the simulations.
      class  RuntimeMonitor
      This class provides a basic framework for implementing runtime monitors.

      Methods in simulator.payloads with parameters of type Networkable 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void ReadablePayload.deliverTo(Networkable networkable)
      This class is implemented by each readable payload so that the call to Networkable.receive() will take place within the Readable class and result in delivery to the correct receive method.
